findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract does not tolerate potential reverts from underlying contracts when interaction is part of the main transfer flow.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword. This means that the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set. Additionally, the constant variables decrease gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow Solidity naming conventions, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Usage of Solidity assembly can make code difficult to read and understand.
